result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J McDowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin J McDowell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin J McDowell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.  $92 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J McDowell

records.addlTxt:
Proceedings: Plea and Sentencing Hearing 
Date: August 12, 2022 
Reporter: Teri Groves.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 8/12/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

Court reporter Teri Groves.  Defendant Kevin J McDowell in court, IN CUSTODY.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2 and 3.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 60 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence F/W-DE currently in custody at DCJ

-Days credit for time served: 44 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D]

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Kevin J McDowell in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a status conference possible plea hearing by request of the DE. DE is waiving his right to counsel. The Court held a colloquy with the defendant prior to approving his waiver of counsel to ensure he was waiving his rights competently, deliberately, and voluntarily.  The court apprised the defendant of his right to counsel, of the advantages of counsel, and of the difficulties and disadvantages of self-representation.  The Court also apprised the defendant of the nature and elements of the charges and the range of possible penalties upon entry of a guilty plea.  Based on this colloquy, the Court approved the defendant's waiver of counsel. 

State speaks with the DE in regards to case. State gives offer. DE would like to proceed to a plea hearing with argued sentencing.

Proceedings: Preliminary Hearing Waiver Arraignment 
Date:  July 19, 2022 
Reporter: Jeanette Sundstrom.
Status conference on August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

01:41 PM Defendant in court, in custody.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
IN CUSTODY
Defn states he doesn't want an attorney. Court colloquy with defendant regarding right to attorney waiver, court accepts oral right to attorney waiver and makes record of acceptance.
 Defendant requests this case be set for a plea as soon as the court's calendar allows.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not be at the East Towne Mall in Madison. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:13 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin J McDowell
Current: c/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703   (Effective: 07-12-2022)
Prior: 615 E Washington Ave, Madison, WI 53703
